Input Methods

To Top

Questions

None documented

Deque questions

Adequate mouse-click target sizes help which of the following user categories? (Select all that apply)

  1. Blind users
  2. Low-vision users
  3. Users with mobility impairments who use a mouse
  4. Colorblind users

Answer: B,C

True or false: Enhanced visual hover indicators help users who can only navigate websites with a keyboard.

  1. True
  2. False

Answer: B

The mouse cursor becomes a hand pointer when the mouse cursor hovers over which of the following native HTML elements?

  1. Buttons
  2. Links
  3. Text fields
  4. A and B

Answer: B

Which of the following items will be focusable with the tab key? (Select all that apply)

  1. A form <input>
  2. A <button> element
  3. A link (<a>) with a valid href value
  4. A <span> element with tabindex="0"
  5. A element with tabindex="-1"
  6. An ARIA link created as follows: <span role="link">

Answer: A,B,C,D

If the tab order is not correct, the best way to fix it is to:

  1. Use tabindex (e.g. tabindex="1", tabindex="1", etc.)
  2. Arrange the order of the elements in the DOM to match the intended tab order.
  3. Use JavaScript to detect onblur events and send the focus to the correct element.
  4. Let the user customize the tab order

Answer: B

Which of the following is NOT an acceptable visual focus indicator style?

  1. a:focus {outline: 0;}
  2. a:focus {outline: red 2px solid;}
  3. button:focus {color: #fff; background: #000; outline: yellow 1px solid}
  4. [role=link] {outline: red 2px solid;}
  5. input[type=text] {border: red 1px dotted blue}

Answer: A

What should be the logical progression of the focus when a person opens and then closes an ARIA dialog?

  1. The focus should go to the dialog, then back to the original button that opened the dialog.
  2. The focus should go to the dialog, then back to the top of the original web page.
  3. The focus should go to the top of the page, then to the dialog, then back to the top of the page.
  4. The focus should go to dialog, then back to the browser address bar.

Answer: A

True or false: A safe keystroke to use for custom keyboard functionality on web pages is the "H" key.

  1. True
  2. False

Answer: B

True or false: Screen readers automatically notify users when a web page implements custom keystrokes.

  1. True
  2. False

Answer: B

True or false: If you code a widget to be fully keyboard-accessible when using the arrow keys, touch devices users (without keyboards) will still not be able to use the widget, in most cases.

  1. True
  2. False

Answer: A

True or false: Custom JavaScript gesture events on web pages will probably not work when a touch device screen reader is turned on.

  1. True
  2. False

Answer: A

The minimum recommended touch target size is:

  1. 10px by 10px
  2. 20px by 20px
  3. 24px by 24px
  4. 36px by 36px
  5. 44px by 44px
  6. 64px by 64px

Answer: E

Voice input or speech recognition software is most commonly used by which of the following user categories? (Select all that apply)

  1. Blind users
  2. Low-vision users
  3. Users with mobility impairments
  4. Deaf users

Answer: C

True or false: The accessibility design and development principles for speech recognition users are largely the same as those for keyboard-only and screen reader users.

  1. True
  2. False

Answer: B

rue or false: When basic Dragon voice commands do not work on a web page, an alternate method that can be used to interact with page content is called "Voice Grid."

  1. True
  2. False

Answer: B

True or false: Dragon provides support for nearly 100% of ARIA attributes.

  1. True
  2. False

Answer: B

A method for pausing or stopping prerecorded video-only content must be provided if play lasts for:

  1. 5 seconds or more
  2. 7 seconds or more
  3. 10 seconds or more
  4. 15 seconds or more

Answer: A

Which of the following statements are true regarding transitions on a web page? (Select all that apply)

  1. Transitions must be used frequently and at a slow rate.
  2. Transitions should be brief and kept to a minimum.
  3. Transitions between foreground and background elements (parallax effects) should occur at a fast rate.
  4. Transitions must not interfere with web page reading or interaction.

Answer: B,D

Animated images must not flash or flicker for:

  1. 2 or more times per second
  2. 3 or more times per second
  3. 5 or more times per second
  4. 8 or more times per second

Answer: B

Interactive elements within content that moves or disappears quickly may be problematic for which groups of users? (Select all that apply)

  1. Keyboard users
  2. Screen reader users
  3. Users who are deaf or hard of hearing
  4. Alternative mouse device users
  5. Users with cognitive disabilities

Answer: A,B,D,E
